awd_abstract_narration:
This award is made as part of the FY 2019 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to Zane Kun Li is "Decoupling inequalities and applications to analytic number theory." The host institution for the fellowship is Indiana University Bloomington, and the sponsoring scientist is Ciprian Demeter.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: Indiana University Bloomington Department of Mathematics

por.por_cntn:
One main focus of this project was to better understand the relationship between the 2015 decoupling and 2017 nested efficient congruencing proofs of Vinogradov's Mean Value Theorem by Bourgain-Demeter-Guth and Wooley, respectively. The former was a purely Fourier analytic proof while the latter was a purely number theoretic proof. One result that came out of this project was joint with Shaoming Guo, Po-Lam Yung and Pavel Zorin-Kranich. We gave a short 10 page new proof of decoupling for the moment curve which inspired by Wooley's efficient congruencing methods. Our proof not only is significantly shorter than the original proof by Bourgain, Demeter, and Guth but also avoids the use of the multilinear Kakeya inequality and has a simpler iteration. This paper was published in the American Journal of Mathematics. The methods from this project introduced new proofs and new ideas into the area of decoupling.


Another main focus was to better understand generalizations and extensions of decoupling to different settings. For example, with Alan Chang, Jaume de Dios Pont, Rachel Greenfeld, Asgar Jamneshan, and Jose Madrid, we extended Bourgain and Demeter's parabola decoupling theorem to decoupling fractal subsets of the parabola. Another generalization I studied joint with Shaoming Guo and Po-Lam Yung lead to the first decoupling theorem over Q_p and gave the current best known upper bound for the discrete restriction constant.


During the course of the award duration, the PI gave two lecture series on decoupling and decoupling's relation to efficient congruencing. The PI's proof of parabola decoupling inspired from efficient congruencing was also used recently in a graduate introductory course in modern harmonic analysis in Spring 2020 taught by Terence Tao to illustrate decoupling theory. The PI also is a co-organizer of the Online Analysis Research Seminar, an online seminar aimed to be accessible to a general mathematical audience with basic knowledge in analysis. Materials from this project was also used to give an introductory level talk aimed at undergraduates at Indiana University.


Last Modified: 10/09/2022
Modified by: Zane K Li
